intro: Heteranthocidium acinaceum, commonly known as the acorn bellflower, is a flowering plant belonging to the Campanulaceae family. It is characterized by its bell-shaped, pale blue to white flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant has hairy stems and leaves that are opposite and lance-shaped. It typically grows in moist, woodland habitats and is found in parts of Europe and Asia. Its botanical features make it a notable species for both ecological and horticultural interest.
